title: Understanding Cognitive Distortions
text: Cognitive distortions are often linked to how we perceive and interpret situations. They can lead to increased anxiety if not addressed.

title: Examples of Cognitive Distortions
text: Common cognitive distortions include all-or-nothing thinking, overgeneralization, and catastrophizing. These patterns can skew our perception of reality.

hintAnswer: patterns of negative thinking often associated with higher anxiety levels
title: Identifying the Correct Definition
text: Which of the following best describes cognitive distortions?
choices: individual’s ability to bounce back from adversity, trauma, or significant stress
patterns of negative thinking often associated with higher anxiety levels
